c74object.name: dada.terrain.segment~
c74object.description: Produces the coordinates of segment paths at sample rate.

outlet.description: Outputs the X coordinate (if polar is 0) or the radius (if polar is 1)
Outputs the Y coordinate (if polar is 0) or the angle (if polar is 1)

objarg.name: polar
objarg.description: If the first argument is the "polar" symbol, the following arguments are considered to be set in polar coordinates.

objarg.name: startpoint
objarg.description: Sets the starting point of the segment path. If the first argument is the "polar" symbol, then the radius and angle are expected, otherwise the X and Y cartesian coordinates are expected.

objarg.name: endpoint
objarg.description: Sets the ending point of the segment path. If the first argument is the "polar" symbol, then the radius and angle are expected, otherwise the X and Y cartesian coordinates are expected.

method.name: signal
method.description: An incoming signal is usually the output of a phasor~ object, i.e. the phase of the path (from 0 = beginning, to 1 = end). The corresponding point on the segment path is computed and output.

attribute.name: end
attribute.description: Sets the cartesian coordinates (X, Y) of the ending point of the segment.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

attribute.name: polar
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to output polar coordinates (radius, from left outlet, and angle, from right outlet). By default it is active; if it is turned off, the output is in cartesian coordinates (X, from left outlet, and Y from right outlet).

attribute.name: polarend
attribute.description: Sets the polar coordinates (radius, angle) of the ending point of the segment.

attribute.name: polarstart
attribute.description: Sets the polar coordinates (radius, angle) of the starting point of the segment.

attribute.name: start
attribute.description: Sets the cartesian coordinates (X, Y) of the starting point of the segment.

entry.name: Outlet 1 (signal)
entry.description: X or radius. Outputs the X coordinate (if polar is 0) or the radius (if polar is 1)

entry.name: Outlet 2 (signal)
entry.description: Y or angle. Outputs the Y coordinate (if polar is 0) or the angle (if polar is 1)
